frontend_crypto_dashboard_upgrades.title: Wallet Connect UI & Status
frontend_crypto_dashboard_upgrades.copilot_prompt:
Implement a WalletConnect component for Crew-7.
Requirements:
1) Show a 'Connect Wallet' button if no wallet is linked.
2) When clicked, in mock mode: open a modal that lets the user paste an address to link; in real Web3 mode (optional), integrate a simple injected provider (e.g., window.ethereum / MetaMask) and request accounts.
3) Display the shortened wallet address, network name (if available), and connection status (Connected/Not Connected).
4) Call backend POST /wallet/link to store the wallet address after user approval.
5) Integrate this component into the top-right of the app header, next to profile/avatar.

Copilot: Keep implementation modular, with a simple hook useWallet() to manage state and API calls.

frontend_crypto_dashboard_upgrades.title: User Token Balance Chip
frontend_crypto_dashboard_upgrades.copilot_prompt:
Create a small token balance chip in the header that shows the user's C7T balance.
Requirements:
1) Fetch from GET /dashboard/stats or /wallet endpoint.
2) Show an icon (token glyph) and balance like '1,250 C7T'.
3) On hover, show a tooltip explaining that C7T is used to rent/buy AI crews.
4) If mock mode is active and the backend returns a flag, show a small 'testnet' or 'simulation' label.

Copilot: Style this chip to match the neon Crew-7 design language and place it near the wallet status.

frontend_crypto_dashboard_upgrades.title: Marketplace Pricing in C7T & Rent/Buy CTAs
frontend_crypto_dashboard_upgrades.copilot_prompt:
Upgrade the Marketplace page to show Crew pricing in C7T and support Rent/Buy actions.
Requirements:
1) Each crew card should show:
   - Price (Buy: base_price_c7t)
   - Rent price (rental_price_c7t per mission or per time unit)
   - XP level and rating (if available)
2) Add buttons:
   - 'Rent Crew' → opens a modal summarizing the rental details and calls POST /market/rent_crew/{crew_id}.
   - 'Buy Crew' → opens a modal with a confirmation and calls POST /market/buy_crew/{crew_id}.
3) After successful Rent/Buy, show a success toast and update the UI to reflect new ownership or active rental.
4) If user lacks enough tokens, show a 'Not enough C7T' message and a link to a 'Get more C7T' info panel.

Copilot: Keep all Web3/crypto wording friendly; explain that tokens may be in test or mock mode.

frontend_crypto_dashboard_upgrades.title: Crew Portfolio & Reputation View
frontend_crypto_dashboard_upgrades.copilot_prompt:
Add a portfolio and reputation section to the Crew Details page.
Requirements:
1) Call GET /crews/{crew_id}/portfolio.
2) Display:
   - Missions completed
   - Hours worked
   - Success rate
   - Rating (stars + number of ratings)
   - Industries served (chips)
   - Total earned C7T
3) Show XP and level with a progress bar and a short description (e.g., 'Level 5 — Senior AI Team').
4) Add a 'Rate this Crew' interaction after a completed mission (stars + optional comment), sending POST /crews/{crew_id}/rate.

Copilot: Design this like a glowing futuristic profile card for the crew, with robot avatars in the header.

frontend_crypto_dashboard_upgrades.title: Dashboard Crypto & Marketplace Cards
frontend_crypto_dashboard_upgrades.copilot_prompt:
Enhance the dashboard with crypto + marketplace insight cards.
Requirements:
1) Show cards for:
   - Total C7T balance
   - Total C7T spent on rentals
   - Total C7T earned by owned crews
   - Number of crews owned
   - Active rentals
2) Use GET /dashboard/stats for data.
3) Add a 'View Marketplace' CTA on the marketplace card, and 'Manage Crews' CTA on the owned crews card.

Copilot: Use the same card component style as existing analytics cards for consistency, but give these cards a subtle token motif.

frontend_crypto_dashboard_upgrades.title: Rental & Ownership Badges
frontend_crypto_dashboard_upgrades.copilot_prompt:
Add visual badges to Crew cards representing ownership and rental status.
Requirements:
1) If user owns the crew: show a 'Owned' badge (e.g., Owner, Co-pilot) and a small C7T earnings icon.
2) If crew is rented by the user: show 'Rented' badge with remaining time or missions.
3) If crew is for sale: show 'For Sale' or 'Available to Rent' with prices.
4) All badge states must be derived from marketplace data and portfolio stats.

Copilot: Make badges small but visually clear, using neon outlines matching the Crew-7 color palette.

frontend_crypto_dashboard_upgrades.title: Wallet & Token Settings Section
frontend_crypto_dashboard_upgrades.copilot_prompt:
Create a settings page for Wallet & Tokens.
Requirements:
1) Show linked wallet address, chain, and a 'Change Wallet' button.
2) Show current C7T balance, basic transaction history (from token_transactions endpoint), and a status indicator (Mock Mode vs Live Mode).
3) Add an educational panel that explains:
   - What C7T is used for (rent/buy crews)
   - That for now it may be running in mock/test mode
4) If in mock mode, allow a 'Request Test Tokens' button that calls a backend endpoint to credit some C7T.

Copilot: Keep the tone clear and beginner-friendly so non-crypto users are not scared away.

frontend_crypto_dashboard_upgrades.title: Advanced Mode Crypto Overlay
frontend_crypto_dashboard_upgrades.copilot_prompt:
Add a small overlay in Advanced Mode showing economic stats for the current run.
Requirements:
1) When a run is created from a rented crew, show:
   - Rental cost in C7T
   - Estimated C7T burn per minute or per mission
2) Show a small status: 'This mission is being executed by a rented crew. Earnings and XP will go to the owner.'
3) If the user owns the crew, show 'Earnings from this mission will go to you.'

Copilot: Keep this overlay subtle and non-blocking; it should add context, not clutter.
